title: Commending The Reverend Gary V. Simpson of The Concord Baptist Church of Christ upon the occasion of his 20th Pastoral Anniversary
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commending  The Reverend Gary V. Simpson of The
Concord Baptist Church of Christ upon the occasion of his 20th  Pastoral
Anniversary

WHEREAS,  The  character and richness of religious and community life in
this noble Empire State is nourished and fulfilled through the  faithful
concern  and  selfless devotion of those who would commit their energies
and purpose to the ministry of others; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to bring full recog-
nition and just tribute to those individuals who distinguish  themselves
and the ministry through their unremitting commitment and preeminence of
service; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is justly proud to commend The Reverend
Gary  V.  Simpson of The Concord Baptist Church of Christ upon the occa-
sion of his 20th Pastoral Anniversary; and
  WHEREAS, Originally from the city of Columbus,  Ohio,  Pastor  Simpson
was  called  by  God to serve at the young age of 15; it was during this
time of his life when he preached his first  sermon  at  the  Southfield
Community  Baptist  Church;  his  passion  for  teaching the Word of God
continued and spurred him to become an ordained preacher at the  age  of
20 through the Eastern Union Missionary Baptist Association; and
  WHEREAS,  However,  Pastor Simpson would not stop there; he earned his
Bachelor of Arts degree from Denison University in 1984, along with  his
Master  of  Divinity  degree from Union Theological Seminary three years
later; he then eventually went on to  receive  his  Doctor  of  Ministry
degree from United Theological Seminary; and
  WHEREAS,  Dr.  Simpson  first  came to Concord in 1984 and acted as an
associate pastor for five years until 1989 when  he  left  to  lead  the
Calvary Baptist Church in Morristown, New Jersey; and
  WHEREAS,  Pastor  Simpson then came back to the Concord Baptist Church
of Christ as Senior Pastor on Sunday, October 7, 1990; since  that  day,
he has proven that he is not only a man who preaches the Word of God but
one  who also encourages his church congregants to assist several chari-
ties; and
  WHEREAS, In the past, The Concord Baptist Church of  Christ  has  been
involved with the Micah Project in order to feed the hungry, the Habitat
for  Humanity to build and give homes to the poor and has made donations
to flood and hurricane victims all over the world; Concord  Baptist  has
also become involved in community service based programs like Alcoholics
Anonymous,  HIV/AIDS  testing  and awareness, blood drives, diabetes and
hypertension awareness; and
  WHEREAS, Pastor Simpson has brought to his  ministry  an  overwhelming
spirit  of  charity and compassion, acting from vision and enlightenment
in conducting his administrative  and  spiritual  duties,  while  always
displaying  the highest standards of personal and professional integrity
and dedication; and
  WHEREAS, This distinguished man of God has always given enlightenment,
guidance and wisdom to the many entrusted to his care and  has  adminis-
tered abundantly and unstintingly to the spiritual and corporal needs of
all; and
  WHEREAS,  It  is the sense of this Legislative Body that when a person
of such noble aims and accomplishments is brought to our attention it is
appropriate to publicly and jubilantly proclaim and commend  that  indi-
vidual for the edification of others; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
commend The Reverend Gary V. Simpson of The Concord  Baptist  Church  of
Christ  upon  the  occasion of his 20th Pastoral Anniversary, noting his

unremitting and compassionate faith and his exemplary  service  to  God,
man and his community, and extending to him the heartfelt best wishes of
this Legislative Body for a future of purposeful success and well-being;
and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to The Reverend Gary V. Simpson.
